TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SHA512Managed extends System.Security.Cryptography.SHA512

Docs.summary: Computes the hash algorithm for the input data using the managed library.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The hash is used as a unique value of fixed size representing a large amount of data. Hashes of two sets of data should match if and only if the corresponding data also matches. Small changes to the data result in large unpredictable changes in the hash.
The hash size for the SHA512Managed algorithm is 512 bits.
## Examples The following example computes the SHA512Managed hash for `data` and stores it in `result`. This example assumes that there is a predefined constant `DATA_SIZE`.
[!code-cpp[Classic SHA512Managed Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.security.crypto_25_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[Classic SHA512Managed Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.security.crypto_25_1.vb)] [!code-cs[Classic SHA512Managed Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.security.crypto_25_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The hash is used as a unique value of fixed size representing a large amount of data. Hashes of two sets of data should match if and only if the corresponding data also matches. Small changes to the data result in large unpredictable changes in the hash.
The hash size for the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SHA512Managed> algorithm is 512 bits.
**Important** If you enable the FIPS security setting either in the Local Security Policy or as part of Group Policy you will get an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> when you attempt to use this constructor.

Docs.exception: The Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) security setting is enabled. This implementation is not part of the Windows Platform FIPS-validated cryptographic algorithms.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override void HashCore (byte[] rgb, int ibStart, int cbSize);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void HashCore(unsigned int8[] rgb, int32 ibStart, int32 cbSize) cil managed

Docs.param: The offset into the byte array from which to begin using data.
The number of bytes in the array to use as data.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, routes data written to the object into the hash algorithm for computing the hash.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is not called by application code.
This abstract method performs the hash computation. Every write to the cryptographic stream object passes the data through this method. For each block of data, this method updates the state of the hash object so a correct hash value is returned at the end of the data stream.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance unsigned int8[] HashFinal() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, finalizes the hash computation after the last data is processed by the cryptographic stream object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is not called by application code. This method finalizes any partial computation and returns the correct hash value of the data stream.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes an instance of the class using the managed library.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The hash is used as a unique value of fixed size representing a large amount of data. Hashes of two sets of data should match if and only if the corresponding data also matches. Small changes to the data result in large unpredictable changes in the hash.
The hash size for the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SHA512Managed> algorithm is 512 bits.
